page.title: 12Transport _ Milk/cattle-food
page.content:
James McKinnon Jnr. of West Hillhead Farm--- Founded in 1932 by James McKinnon with one lorry, this firm, managed now by his son Robert has a fleet of 18 lorries: 9 milk tankers, 9 bulk grain carriers and 7 buses (member of A1 Bus Services).
The milk tankers collect from 178 farms throughout Ayrshire approx. 40,000 gallons of milk per day. This is taken to dairies for the milk trade or to factories to be made into Galloway cheese, Feta cheese,(exported to Egypt) evaporated milk, (Carnation brand) and milk chocolate (Rowantree at Girvan).
The bulk grain carriers collect and deliver approx. 300 tons of animal feed per day.
